channel.title: The Readheads Book Club
channel.itunes:summary:
Welcome to The Readheads Book Club, your new favorite book club and podcast!
Hosted by The Morning Toast’s Jackie Oshry, and co-hosted by some of her best friends, each month they'll choose a new book to read, dissect, and chat about here on The Readheads Book Club.
channel.itunes:author: Dear Media
channel.description:
Welcome to The Readheads Book Club, your new favorite book club and podcast!
Hosted by The Morning Toast’s Jackie Oshry, and co-hosted by some of her best friends, each month they'll choose a new book to read, dissect, and chat about here on The Readheads Book Club.

item.title: Hester
item.description:
Happy November Readheads! Our new episode is here and we are recapping and discussing Hester by Laurie Loco Albanese. This book is a little Nathaniel Hawthorne fan fiction - it imagines the backstory that might have inspired him to write The Scarlett Letter. Plus, it's the perfect book to read for Spooky Season! As always the hosts are also sharing the other books they read this month and whether or not they'd recommend them.

The next book is Dana's choice and she chose Horse by Geraldine Brooks.

The overall Readheads rating for Hester is 3.8.

Follow @thereadheads on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/thereadheads/

Shop The Readheads merch:

https://shopmorningtoast.com/collections/the-readheads

Join our Facebook group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/thereadheads/

Submit a question or comment to us at thereadheadsbookclub@gmail.com

item.title: Lessons in Chemistry
item.itunes:title: Lessons in Chemistry
item.description:
Happy October Readheads! In this new episode we are recapping and discussing Lessons in Chemistry by Bonnie Garmus, a Jackie's Choice. The girlies are mostly on the same page during this episode so they're sharing their favorite moments and characters from the book. Also they break down the latest cast photos from the upcoming series Lessons in Chemistry on Apple TV+. As always they're also sharing the other books they read this month and whether or not they'd recommend them.

The next book is Becky's choice and she chose Hester by Laurie Albanese.

The overall Readheads rating for Lessons in Chemistry is 4.325.

Follow @thereadheads on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/thereadheads/

Join our Facebook group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/thereadheads/

Submit a question or comment to us at thereadheadsbookclub@gmail.com

item.title: 40: Everything I Know About Love
item.itunes:title: Everything I Know About Love
item.description: Happy September Readheads! In this month's episode of The Readheads Book Club we are recapping and discussing Everything I Know About Love, a memoir by Dolly Alderton. We are talking about our favorite moments and stories from this book and what themes and passages really resonated with each of us. This book has just been made into a series on Peacock so we're talking about our thoughts on the casting in lieu of the Hollywood Treatment. As always we each also share all of the other books we read this month. Next month's book is Jackie's choice and she choice Lessons in Chemistry by Bonnie Garmus. The overall Readheads rating for Everything I Know About Love is 3.675. Follow @thereadheads on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/thereadheads/ Join our Facebook group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/thereadheads/ Submit a question or comment to us at thereadheadsbookclub@gmail.com

item.title: 39: A Flicker in the Dark
item.itunes:title: A Flicker in the Dark
item.description: Happy August! In this episode of The Readheads Book Club we are recapping and discussing A Flicker in the Dark by Stacy Willingham. This is our first thriller in a while and suffice it to say, we all loved it! We are talking about our favorite elements, themes and when we were the most shook. The next book is Margo's choice and she chose Everything I Know About Love by Dolly Alderton. The overall Readheads Rating for A Flicker in the Dark is 4.4.

item.title: 38: Girls With Bright Futures
item.itunes:title: Girls With Bright Futures
item.description: Happy 4th of July! We're dropping the new episode of The Readheads a few days early because we were all so excited about this months book. In this episode we are recapping and discussing Girls With Bright Futures with a very special guest, Claudia Oshry! She's an honorary Readhead and she read along with us this month so she's joining us for the episode. As always we're talking about the best and worst parts of the book and all of the other books we read this month. The next book is Dana's choice and she chose A Flicker in the Dark by Stacy Willingham. The overall Readheads Rating for Girls With Bright Futures is 4.08.

item.title: 37: Run, Rose, Run
item.itunes:title: Run, Rose, Run
item.description: In this episode of The Readheads the girlies are discussing Run, Rose, Run by James Patterson and Dolly Parton. An epic collab. The Readheads are sharing all the things they loved about the book and some of the things they didn't. As always they share their picks for who they'd cast in a movie adaptation of this book and they share and rate all of the other books they read this month. The next book is Becky's choice and she chose Girls with Bright Futures by Tracy Dobmeier and Wendy Katzman. item.title: 34: Ghosts of Gotham
item.itunes:title: Ghosts of Gotham
item.description: Welcome back Readheads to our most heated episode of The Readheads Book Club yet! This month we are recapping and discussing Ghosts of Gotham by Craig Schaefer, our first real foray into the science fiction genre. We've got lots of dissenting opinions and hot takes about this book so whether or not you enjoyed it, there's something for everyone! Plus as always, the girls are sharing the other books they read this month and whether or not they'd recommend them. The next book is Dana's choice and she chose Our Country Friends by Gary Shteyngart. Reminder: The next episode will drop on April 7th. Follow @thereadheads on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/thereadheads/ Join our Facebook group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/thereadheads/ Submit a question or comment to us at thereadheadsbookclub@gmail.com Shop Readheads Merch: https://shopmorningtoast.com/collections/the-readheads The overall Readheads Rating for Ghosts of Gotham is 2.75 stars.

item.title: 28: Klara and The Sun
item.itunes:title: Klara and The Sun
item.description: In this month's episode of The Readheads Book Club we are discussing our most recent book, Klara and The Sun by Kazuo Ishiguro. The girls have a lot of differing opinions about this book. They're answering some of the bigger questions the book poses and trying to decipher what it all meant. Plus they're answering your questions and casting a Hollywood version of the book. As always they're sharing and reviewing the other books we read this month. The next book is Margo's choice and she chose We Are the Brennans by Tracey Lange. item.title: 27: The Nature of Fragile Things
item.itunes:title: The Nature of Fragile Things
item.description: Welcome back to The Readheads Book Club! In this month's episode we are recapping and discussing The Nature of Fragile Things by Susan Meissner. We are breaking down the major storylines in the novel and sharing what we thought of each character and the book as a whole. In this episode we also do a brief review of Malibu Rising by Taylor Jenkins Reid. We also share the other books we read this month and recommend our favorites. The next book is Dana's choice and she chose Klara and the Sun by Kazuo Ishiguro. In this episode we also do a brief review of Malibu Rising by Taylor Jenkins Reid. We also share the other books we read this month and recommend our favorites. The next book is Dana's choice and she chose Klara and the Sun by Kazuo Ishiguro. item.itunes:title: The Invisible Life of Addie LaRue
item.description: It's the last episode of 2020 and The Readheads are recapping and discussing one of their favorite books they've read this year, The Invisible Life of Addie LaRue by V. E. Schwab. They're talking about the story, the main characters and which curse they'd prefer, Addie's or Henry's. Plus they're sharing their casting picks for a movie adaption of this book (which is happening by the way)! In the second half of the episode the girls share their favorite Readheads books of the year and their favorite non-Readheads books they read this year. We hope you enjoy this episode and we want to say thank you for joining our book club this year! We have loved reading and discussing these books with all of you and we are so excited to read even more in 2021. The next book is Margo's choice and she chose Layla by Colleen Hoover. These are ladies we all know and love who have been torn down by tabloids and dissected by social media—all while facing career obstacles, broken relationships, and incredible triumphs and have come out of it all even stronger. You can read along, or just listen, but either way, you definitely want to join this book club.  Celebrity Book Club is OUT NOW in Stitcher, Apple Podcasts, or wherever you listen: https://link.chtbl.com/celebritybookclub

item.title: 16: My 90s Playlist
item.itunes:title: My 90s Playlist
item.description: The 90s are back in so many ways, but our favorite tracks never left. My 90s Playlist breaks down why we love the hits of the 90s so much, what made our favorite songs so popular back then, and why we are so nostalgic for them now. Throughout the season, our hosts Tracy Clayton and Akoto Ofori-Atta will celebrate their picks for a quintessential 90s playlist and explore the work of Backstreet Boys, Mariah Carey, Celine Dion, A Tribe Called Quest and more! Weekly episodes start October 13th!

item.description: For the newest book club episode, The Readheads are recapping Code Name Hélène by Ariel Lawhon, a World War II Historical Fiction novel that tells the story of real life heroine, Nancy Wake. The Readheads have no choice but to stan Nancy throughout this book. Jackie, Dana, Becky & Snitch are recapping and discussing the novel and sharing their thoughts on who they envisioned as each character. The next book is Becky's choice and she chose I Know Why The Caged Bird Sings by Maya Angelou. Follow @thereadheads on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/thereadheads/ Join our Facebook group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/thereadheads/ Submit a question or comment to us at thereadheadsbookclub@gmail.com The overall Readheads Rating for Code Name Hélène is 3.975 stars.

item.title: 7: The Glass Hotel
item.itunes:title: The Glass Hotel
item.description: The Readheads are discussing the most complex and polarizing book choice yet, The Glass Hotel by Emily St. James Mandel. Join us as Jackie, Dana, Becky & Snitch break down the major themes of the book and discuss the moments and quotes that stuck out most to them. As always they're sharing who should play the characters in a Hollywood adaption of the book and discussing other titles they read this week. The next book is Jackie's choice and she chose Code Name Hélène by Ariel Lawhon. item.title: 6: In Five Years
item.itunes:title: In Five Years
item.description: It's the First Thursday in May and the newest episode of The Readheads Book Club is here! The girls are recapping and discussing In Five Years by Rebecca Searle. They're sharing all of their favorite parts, the things that most surprised them, and who they saw as each character. Plus they're sharing all of the other books that they read this month and whether or not they think you should read them too! The next book is Jackie's choice and she chose The Glass Hotel by Emily St. John Mandel. Follow @thereadheads on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/thereadheads/ Join our Facebook group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/thereadheads/ Submit a question or comment to us at thereadheadsbookclub@gmail.com Update Description The overall Readheads Rating for In Five Years is 3.5 stars.

item.title: 5: Before We Were Strangers
item.itunes:title: Before We Were Strangers
item.description: The Readheads are up to two episodes per month during quarantine so we're here with the second episode of April recapping Before We Were Strangers by Renee Carlino. We are discussing all of the major themes and storylines from the book and sharing how the book spoke to us. All of the hosts (and listeners) loved reading this book so recording this podcast was a true pleasure. Enjoy! The next book is Margo's choice part 2 and she chose In Five Years by Rebecca Serle. item.title: 3: Red, White & Royal Blue
item.itunes:title: Red, White & Royal Blue
item.description: This month's Readhead Book Of The Month is Red, White & Royal Blue by Casey McQuiston. In this episode Jackie, Margo, Dana and Becky break down all of their thoughts on the novel and share their favorite (and least favorite) elements and characters from the book. They're asking each other insightful document based questions, and responding to some of your questions as well. We hope you enjoy this episode and join us next month when the book is Dana's choice. Dana has chosen Nothing To See Here by Kevin Wilson as her book of the month. Follow @thereadheads on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/thereadheads/ Join our Facebook group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/thereadheads/ Submit a question or comment to us at thereadheadsbookclub@gmail.com The overall Readheads Rating for Red, White & Royal Blue is 3.125 stars.

item.title: 2: The Husband's Secret
item.itunes:title: The Husband's Secret
item.description: In the first episode of The Readheads Book Club, the girls are recapping, discussing and rating The Husband's Secret by Liane Moriarty. They're discussing major themes in the story, answering some of the hard questions the book poses, and sharing their casting recommendations for a movie based on the book. Plus, they give the book their overall Readheads Book Club rating and share Becky's choice for next month's read. Enjoy! Follow @thereadheadsbookclub for more: https://www.instagram.com/thereadheadsbookclub/ The overall Readheads Rating for The Husband's Secret is 2.875 stars.
